Twin River Foods chemical accident prevention and emergency response policies for ammonia refrigeration involve the development of this Risk Management Program and Plan (*RMP*), which has a primary objective of preventing an accidental release of ammonia, and in the event there is one, minimize the consequences of the release.



The stationary source subject to this RMP is Twin River Foods' poultry processing facility located in Fort Smith, AR. The facility has one refrigeration system which contains anhydrous ammonia, a regulated substance under the RMP regulations.



The location has prepared a worst case release scenario, with distance to the toxic endpoint using the RMP Comp software. The alternate case release scenario, with distance to the toxic endpoint was prepared using RMPComp software also.



In accordance with RMP regulations, the general accidental release prevention program for this facility's ammonia refrigeration system is comprised of the following components: Process Safety Information, Process Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Operator Training, Mechanical Integrity Procedures, Management of Change Procedures, Pre-Start Up Safety Procedures, Incident Investigation Procedures, and Hot Work Permit protocols. This program was developed with the participation of the affected employees and will be periodically audited for compliance as required by the RMP regulations. In addition, the facility has in place procedures for notifying contractors and thier employees of the hazards of the process. Chemical specific prevention steps are included within the program, including engineering and administrative controls designed to prevent and minimize accidental releases.



The facility has had no accidental releases of ammonia.



This facility has developed an Emergency Action Plan which addresses accidental release of hazardous substances and has coordinated with the Sebastian County Local Emergency Planning Commission (LEPC). The facility is included

in the LEPC's community emergency response plan.



The Process Hazard Analysis report prepared for the facility in January 2013 identified various recommendations to minimize the risk of accidental releases and improve safety related to the ammonia refrigeration system. All of the recommendations from the 2013 PHA have been resolved , with the exception of computer program.
